rComments: Ronnie is overall a very pleasant professor to have and you know that he cares about the material he is teaching, especially those subject matters relating to sex... yeah... He's a bit quirky, and sometimes rambles, but overall provides a good introduction into philosophy. Go to tutorial and lecture, or have fun burying your head in books.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: His lectures are amazing and hilarious! He made 3 hour long night lectures so easy to deal with, his jokes and ideas really grab your attention. The assignments are pretty straight forward, but he does grade pretty hard, so definitely put in some work or take it as an elective to CR/NCR

Talks really slowly but other than that he is great. His understanding of logical principles within philosophy is what makes him so great as he is able to understand questions and arguments and properly answer them. It seems that he truly does care about the success of his students as well.

Ronnie is an absolute beauty.. lectures were always entertaining and assignments were interesting and complex. Marking is generous if you work hard. This course is rewarding and you will get out of it what you put in. Attend lectures, do readings, and make sure you take time on assignments.. BEAUTY

The best part about Ronnie's classes were his anecdotes about his youth, mostly about sex or drugs, but honestly, he is a real good philosopher and usually makes the dense reading material more clear in lecture.

Incredible lecturer, to the point where I suspect he was a stage actor previously. The British accent helps. He goes into decent depth on all topics surveyed, though referring to the original texts is very much necessary for a grade over a B-. His passion for the subject comes across very clearly.

An awesome professor, especially in a field with such difficult concepts! He's older and has an uncensored sense of humour, which is hilarious. Attending lectures is important, as the material in the texts you use definitely requires explanation in-class. The exam questions are given before the exam. Get TA advice before submitting each paper!
Professor gives too much reading. It is extremely hard to get a good grade.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Tough grader', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Good lecturer, nice guy. He does grade quite harshly and can be a little unpredictable. Its a relatively tough course but definitely a fun one.

Prof. De Sousa is simply brilliant. One of the most intelligent and educated people I've met. His lectures are interesting and well-structured. He is also very funny and swears a lot (the latter wouldn't work for anyone) which adds to his charm. Attendance is not mandatory but recommended since his explanations are very clear and thorough. He rocks
Favourite prof at U of T so far. Tough grader but you're going to have to take a hard course eventually.
good professor
Although the class itself isn't necessarily easy, professor de Sousa makes it more manageable and is super interesting.
His lectures are pretty passionate and he's hilarious. Never went to him for help, I just went and saw my ta, but he has office hours during project and exam time.

Posts lecture slides, but highly recommend going to lectures - he's a fantastic speaker and he really will lay out the content of the slide clearly. It will make sense if you pay attention.  Do the readings, and show up to lectures, and you'll be just fine.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Hilarious', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: His lectures were boring, and they were very hard to for me to follow. His marking is incredibly hard, and sometimes his lectures were seemed irrelevant. I wanted to like him, but he I just could't seem to. However, I talked to many people that liked him, and his teaching style. It's just a personal preference thing.

Ronnie gave long, dry lectures about interesting material. He often cared more about sounding smart than actually teaching his students. As a first year student, we covered an excessive amount of readings and philosophers, and the assignments were tough. Tutorials saved me!
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Fun and interesting Prof. I nearly dropped his course due to the first assignment being painfully difficult but persevered. After doing it I'm pretty sure it was purposely like that to sort the wheat from the chaff as the rest was a breeze. Marking is very fair and his lectures prepare you significantly for the final exam. Recommend.

I love Ronnie so much. He's my favorite professor ever. Super helpful, super hilarious, and just overall super amazing. The way he talks is so distinctive, I can listen to him talk forever. Yeah he may be biased, but his opinions are worth listening to. If I could, I would take this course over and over and over again.

the worst professor I have ever had after 4+ years studying philosophy. Totally unclear. Terrible slides, and unorganized lectures. He brought in SO MUCH useless jargon and useless diversions. It almost seemed like he was showing off how much he knew instead of teaching a course. His presentation of the categorical imperative was embarrassing!!!!!!

This is a very eye opening course that I think  everyone should take and Ronnie is probably the best prof for it. Very knowledgeable and witty. People can say he's pompous but if he wasn't then there would be nothing overly interesting about the lectures.

Amazing professor. Fun and witty but also extremely intelligent and interesting. Posts lecture slides but important to go to class to make sense of them. 3 hour lectures were always kept interesting. Favourite course I have taken yet. Very fair exam.

I do not like the fact that he is very prejudiced in some of his opinions and misconstrues some information but overall the class ain't too bad... He just needs to learn to be more impartial and allow students to make the conclusion as opposed to preach his views.

After handing back the first assignment he will admit that he purposely made it harder than it should have been in order to have students drop his course. I enjoyed his lectures, but was turned off from the fact that he tries to make the students do poorly.

Agree with the previous reviewer. An extremely opinionated and politicized prof  with prejudiced and unfair TAs. The course topics are repetitions with variations; excessive amount of repetitive readings; lecture slides are unorganized; lectures merely repeat the content of slides with occasional jokes and swearing.

He seems very educated and classy, but kind of pompous, especially with his Oxford English pronunciation. He makes a lot of jokes and swears a lot but I think it is to make him seem more cool and radical. He is a good teacher and we watched and covered some really great material in class. Hard marker though and tough material.
Before taking his class, I was stuck in a cave just like in Plato's allegory of the cave. Finishing his class and visiting him during office hours helped me get out of the cave now. :D

Love him! So charismatic and interesting, funny as hell and probably the most brilliant prof. of philosophy I've yet to meet. Really cool guy outside the class too. I go out of my way to take classes he teaches, and if you never take one of his, you're missing out.

Great teaching style. Makes jokes. Organized and well mannered. Concise and clear in his lectures. Exams proved easy if you read material. Practical Ethics is by far the best contemporary ethical texted I've read, and he taught the material well.
Very energetic and knowledgeable. Reasonable man outside class setting.

His mind is so convuluted that he's either psychotic or brilliant. I'm sure he'd prefer the latter. I endured his class for 2 lectures and then got nervous (and CONFUSED!) and dropped it. In retrospect I probably should've stayed, seems like a hard marker but seems like you'd actually benefit from the classroom experience. I've heard good things.

My comments certainly echo the previous post. I finished with a mark of exactly 79.4% and ended up with a 78% for my final. After emailing him he said he had discretion to give me a mark in the B+ range or A- range.  He seemed to be a reasonable human being in class but this event drastically changed my opinion of him.
sneaky ****. didnt help you at all through his emails. Curves down for essays. Made the exam the trickiest thing ever. If you wanna take this class make sure hes not the prof
wonderful
can't believe me saying this, i miss him being my teacher.
Funny guy, very smart (and knows it - quite arrogant and conceited).  Blamed the class (we didn't study hard enough) when the test was too hard and the average was 48%.
like a living Jesus
funny guy
If Plato, Hume and Descartes weren't dead, I would kill them... BUT prof = #1
First prof I've had who has a sense of humour
Ronnie is a great speaker.  These profs are few and far between!
No Comments
No Comments
dude...hilarious
Excellent speaker, loud, clear. Swears in class, FUNNY!!!
Ronni is good but Plato and Decartes SUCK
No Comments
No Comments
He told me to stop coming to class
Smart and witty.  Makes learning about Reductio Ad Absurdums fun
I Love you Ronnie!
this man is my God!
